com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map

Class MapResourcePack

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map.MapResourcePack
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ServerResourcePack, VanillaResourcePack

    public class MapResourcePack
extends java.lang.Object
    Resource Management class that loads models and textures from the Vanilla Minecraft jar or zip resource pack archives.

    Before using, call VANILLA.load() when enabling your plugin to download and install this Minecraft client jar. This downloading is only performed once.

    The Minecraft client resources are owned by Mojang. These assets are installed separately from BKCommonLib. BKCommonLib, nor its developers, distribute (illegal) copies of the Minecraft client. We assume you have already accepted the Minecraft EULA to run the server. If you have not, please read https://account.mojang.com/documents/minecraft_eula.

    • Nested Class Summary

      A type of resource that can be read from a Resource Pack

    • Field Detail

      • VANILLA

        public static final VanillaResourcePack VANILLA
        The default VANILLA resource pack consists of the default Minecraft models and textures. These resources are provided by the Minecraft client jar. Resource packs extend or override these default resources.

        Before using, call VANILLA.load() when enabling your plugin to download and install this Minecraft client jar. This downloading is only performed once. Doing this here prevents long lag pauses the first time your plugin accesses this resource pack.

        The Minecraft client resources are owned by Mojang. These assets are installed separately from BKCommonLib. BKCommonLib, nor its developers, distribute (illegal) copies of the Minecraft client. We assume you have already accepted the Minecraft EULA to run the server. If you have not, please read https://account.mojang.com/documents/minecraft_eula.

      • SERVER

        public static final MapResourcePack SERVER
        The SERVER resource pack consists of the default Minecraft models and textures, unless a special resource pack is defined in server.properties. Then the resource pack defined there is downloaded and used for providing the textures and models.

        Before using, call SERVER.load() when enabling your plugin to download and install this Minecraft client jar, and the resource pack of the server if it is defined. This downloading is only performed once. Doing this here prevents long lag pauses the first time your plugin accesses this resource pack.

                       java.lang.String resourcePackHash)
        Loads a new resource pack, extending the default VANILLA resource pack
        Parameters:
        resourcePackPath - of the resource pack to load. File or URL.
        resourcePackHash - SHA1 hash of the resource pack to detect changes (when URL)

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load()
        Initializes the resource pack and all underlying resource packs. This is called automatically once the resource packs are first accessed. To initialize up-front and avoid lazy initialization at runtime, call this method at the very beginning.

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        Clears all cached models and textures, forcing a reload from the pack archive(s)

      • getBlockModel

        public final Model getBlockModel(org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Obtains the model for a particular Block in the World. Block-specific rendering options are efficiently handled here.

        Returns:

        public Model getBlockModel(BlockRenderOptions blockRenderOptions)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getModel

        public Model getModel(java.lang.String path)
        Loads a JSON-syntax model from this resource pack.
        Parameters:
        path - to the model, e.g. "block/stone"
        Returns:
        the model, a placeholder cube model if it could not be found
